Connecting to the MySQL-/MariaDB-database

Source: R/db.R
certedb.Rd

Makes a connection to a MySQL-/MariaDB-database like the Certe-databaseserver.

Usage,
certedb(
  host = read_secret("db.mmb.host"),
  port = read_secret("db.mmb.port"),
  username = read_secret("db.mmb.username"),
  password = read_secret("db.mmb.password"),
  dbname = "certemmb",
  info = FALSE
)

Arguments

host, port, username, password

Default is the current user's environment variables: "db.mmb.host" (if missing will be localhost), "db.mmb.port" (if missing will be 3306), "db.mmb.username" and "db.mmb.password". Login credentials for the MySQL/MariaDB-server.

dbname

Default is "certemmb". Name of the database to be selected.

info

Default is FALSE. Display of connecting info.

See also

certedb_query for the use of query's and certedb_close for closing a connection.

Examples

if (FALSE) {

# download data directly to tibble:
locaties <- certe_db() %>%
  tbl("temporary_certemm_locaties") %>%
  collect()

# only show query without running it:
locaties <- certe_db() %>%
  tbl("temporary_certemm_locaties") %>%
  show_query()

# works with dpylr functions like filter() and select():
locaties <- certe_db() %>%
  tbl("temporary_certemm_locaties") %>%
  filter(zkhgroepcode > 0, cu_sd == "Noord") %>%
  select(instelling) %>%
  collect()

# use head() like LIMIT in MySQL:
locaties <- certe_db() %>%
  tbl("temporary_certemm_locaties") %>%
  head(5) %>%
  collect()
}
